immutable_prompts.description: My ultimate goal is to one day build an underwater city, and I am focused on collecting the skills, connecting with people, and understanding the resources necessary to achieve this. I am deeply interested in the multidisciplinary aspects of creating and inhabiting underwater environments. This encompasses robotics for subsea construction and maintenance, the unique challenges of underwater architecture and structural engineering, and innovations in materials science like 3D concrete printing for marine applications. My interests also include the geology of the underwater world, the integration of marine ecosystems (including diverse fish populations) with human-made structures, and the human experience of exploring these environments through scuba diving and freediving. I am keen on learning about seasteading concepts and practical implementations as potential pathways or related endeavors. I'm looking for technical papers, case studies, project proposals, and discussions that contribute to this long-term vision.

mutable_prompts.description: Current research focus: Investigating the interplay between advanced welding techniques, stainless steel applications, and underwater volcanic environments in the construction of subsea habitats. This study explores the integration of ROV capabilities, fish biology, and coral ecosystem dynamics in habitat design, while addressing the economic impacts of tariffs on material costs and supply chains. The research emphasizes joining academic and professional groups specializing in undersea habitation, particularly in the Long Beach area, to gain practical knowledge and expand networking opportunities. This approach aims to develop sustainable underwater structures that advance the vision of inhabitable subsea cities, with a focus on active participation in diving events and groups to foster connections and gain hands-on experience. The study also delves into the logistical complexities of building and maintaining subsea structures in volcanic environments, considering both human expertise and ROV capabilities, while exploring the potential of underwater robotics in construction and maintenance processes.
